events.originalText: The United States repealed its controversial "don't ask, don't tell" policy on gay, lesbian and bisexual people in the military.
events.subtitle: Don't Ask, Don't Tell Repeal Act of 2010
events.headline: United States repeals 'don't ask, don't tell' policy in military

events.originalText: A dike ruptured at a waste containment area for a coal-fired power plant in Kingston, Tennessee, releasing 1.1 billion gallons (4.2 million m3) of coal fly ash slurry (aftermath pictured) in the largest industrial spill in US history.
events.subtitle: Kingston Fossil Plant coal fly ash slurry spill
events.headline: Dike rupture causes largest industrial spill in US history

events.originalText: Burhanuddin Rabbani of the Northern Alliance handed over power in Afghanistan to the interim government headed by Hamid Karzai.
events.subtitle: Burhanuddin Rabbani
events.headline: Burhanuddin Rabbani hands over power in Afghanistan to Hamid Karzai

events.originalText: Richard Reid unsuccessfully attempted to detonate a bomb in his shoe on a transatlantic flight from Paris to Miami.
events.subtitle: Richard Reid
events.headline: Richard Reid attempts shoe bomb attack on transatlantic flight

events.originalText: Hussein Farrah Aidid relinquished the disputed title of President of Somalia.
events.subtitle: Hussein Farrah Aidid
events.headline: Hussein Farrah Aidid relinquishes title of President of Somalia

events.originalText: Brazilian unionist and environmental activist Chico Mendes was murdered at his home in Xapuri.
events.subtitle: Trade union
events.headline: Brazilian activist Chico Mendes murdered at home in Xapuri

events.originalText: While riding a New York City Subway train, Bernhard Goetz shot four African-American youths who had attempted to rob him, sparking a nationwide debate on vigilantism, racism, and the legal limits of self-defense.
events.subtitle: New York City Subway
events.headline: Bernhard Goetz shoots African-American youths on NYC Subway

events.originalText: Cultural Revolution: The People's Daily published a piece by Chinese leader Mao Zedong directing that "the intellectual youth must go to the country, and will be educated from living in rural poverty".
events.subtitle: Cultural Revolution
events.headline: Mao Zedong directs intellectual youth to live in rural poverty

events.originalText: The Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird, the United States Air Force's long-range, Mach 3+ strategic reconnaissance aircraft and the world's fastest air-breathing manned aircraft, made its first flight.
events.subtitle: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird
events.headline: Lockheed SR-71 Blackbird makes first flight

events.originalText: Chaired by Sjafruddin Prawiranegara, the Emergency Government of the Republic of Indonesia was established to counter Dutch attempts to re-assert colonial control.
events.subtitle: Sjafruddin Prawiranegara
events.headline: Emergency Government of Indonesia established to counter Dutch control

events.originalText: Members of the All-India Muslim League observed a "Day of Deliverance" to celebrate the resignations of members of the Indian National Congress over the decision to enter the Second World War at the request of the United Kingdom.
events.subtitle: All-India Muslim League
events.headline: All-India Muslim League celebrates 'Day of Deliverance'

events.originalText: The Lincoln Tunnel, connecting New York City to Weehawken, New Jersey, opened.
events.subtitle: Lincoln Tunnel
events.headline: Lincoln Tunnel opens connecting NYC to Weehawken

events.originalText: The Congress of Soviets approved the GOELRO plan, the first Soviet plan for national economic recovery and development.
events.subtitle: Congress of Soviets
events.headline: Congress of Soviets approves first Soviet economic recovery plan

events.originalText: In an effort to avoid engaging in the Napoleonic Wars, the United States Congress passed the Embargo Act, forbidding American ships from engaging in trade with foreign nations.
events.subtitle: Napoleonic Wars
events.headline: US Congress passes Embargo Act to avoid Napoleonic Wars

events.originalText: Defeated by the Burmese Konbaung dynasty, Qing China agreed to a peace treaty to end the Sino-Burmese War.
events.subtitle: Konbaung dynasty
events.headline: Qing China agrees to peace treaty ending Sino-Burmese War

events.originalText: An earthquake registering an estimated 7.9 Ms struck the eastern Alborz mountains in Persia, causing an estimated 200,000 deaths.
events.subtitle: 856 Damghan earthquake
events.headline: Earthquake in Persia causes estimated 200,000 deaths

events.originalText: Pope Innocent I began his papacy, succeeding Anastasius I.
events.subtitle: Pope Innocent I
events.headline: Pope Innocent I begins papacy, succeeding Anastasius I

events.originalText: Roman emperor Vitellius was captured by soldiers loyal to Vespasian and executed at the Gemonian stairs in Rome.
events.subtitle: AD 69
events.headline: Roman emperor Vitellius captured and executed in Rome
